common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Integration Issues
common_issues.description: Users report various integration issues between Pieces OS and Desktop App, including account linking problems, dependency connection errors, and difficulties installing third-party tools. Solutions range from manual account merging to awaiting new feature releases and scheduling debugging calls.

Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.8 2025-02-17

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces for Developers hangs on first run in third step (Verify Dependency Connections) with error message

unable to open Pieces Core Services
formatexception: Invalid port (at character 16)
http://0.0.0.0:null/connect

Pieces OS seems to work fine, for a brief moment I can see its window with information that the service is active on some port. Then window closes - it is impossible to bring it back, but icon in the  system tray is still there.

How can I set proper port value for Pieces for Developer, and what is the default port value?
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Problem:** 
* mariusz-kowalski reported a problem opening localhost.
* This issue seems similar to other reported cases related to specific Linux machines.
* The exact cause is unknown.

**Key points:**
* The issue was automatically routed to the Pieces team.
* Related issues and resources were provided.
* Logs and a video call were requested for further troubleshooting.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**
* Provide logs from "Users/<user>/Documents/com.pieces.pfd/production/logs".
* Join a video call for live troubleshooting.

**Current status/outcome:**
* Logs have been provided.
* User is unable to join a video call.
* Further investigation is needed to identify the root cause and propose a solution.

**Additional notes:**
* The conversation suggests the issue might be specific to Linux machines.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation

**Key points raised:**

* Johnkennyuk is unable to link their GitHub and Google accounts in Pieces.
* The current account linking system is not intuitive and has known bugs.
* Pieces is actively working on a replacement account linking system that will be more robust.

**Problems identified:**

* Existing account linking flow is not up to par.
* Two separate accounts were created due to a bug in earlier versions of Pieces.
* A capital letter discrepancy in email addresses appears to be hindering account linking.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces offered to manually merge the two accounts via Pieces support.
* Johnkennyuk was instructed to sign out and sign back in with the desired account to trigger the account linking flow.
* Mark-at-pieces suggested disabling email privacy settings in the Github account temporarily.
* Mark-at-pieces reset Johnkennyuk's Github account to address potential linking issues.
* Pieces is developing a new and improved account linking system for future implementation.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Account linking issue is unresolved as of the last conversation (February 5th, 2025).
* Account linking remains problematic due to a possible capital letter issue in email addresses.
* Johnkennyuk opted to wait for the new account linking system to be released.
* Pieces plans to release the new account linking system in early/mid March 2025.

**Additional notes:**

* Johnkennyuk confirmed that they are not a developer, but expressed their understanding of email address case insensitivity and potential coding solutions.
* Johnkennyuk will be notified when the new account linking system is ready for testing. 

**Overall, the conversation highlights the challenges associated with the current account linking system and the ongoing efforts to implement a more reliable solution.**

related_issues.title: Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces OS instance's Ollama server would always give errors regarding various Cuda dll files not being registered or not found, so I then installed Ollama server from its source which works and Pieces OS could also connect too and use, the problem I'm facing now is that Pieces OS on startup seems to keep starting its own Ollama instance rather than using the externally installed Ollama server instance which means I see the Cuda dll errors again.  My workaround is that I must quit Pieces OS completely then start Ollama server from its own shortcut then start Pieces OS??

Any Ideas??
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Johnkennyuk reported Cuda errors when using Ollama with Pieces OS.
* Ollama installation via Pieces OS was causing issues with an externally installed Ollama instance.
* Startup order appeared to be a potential issue, with Pieces OS attempting to start Ollama before the external instance was fully loaded.

**Problems Identified:**

* Conflicts between the Ollama installations causing Cuda errors.
* Pieces OS not detecting the externally installed Ollama instance.
* Race condition between Pieces OS and Ollama startup leading to errors.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Uninstall and reinstall Ollama using the OllamaSetup.exe installer.
* Manually check and clean the system path.
* Potential fix for startup race condition implemented in Pieces OS version 11.1.2.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Johnkennyuk reported the issue resolved after multiple uninstalls, path cleanups, and updates.
* Johnkennyuk re-reported the issue after further updates.
* A potential fix has been implemented, but further testing is required.

**Additional Notes:**

* Johnkennyuk requested the ability for Pieces OS to detect and interact with external Ollama instances.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving Pieces OS and Desktop App integration issues:** This is the most frequent problem category with high activity levels. Focus on improving account linking, dependency connections, and third-party tool installations.
**Investigate and fix JetBrains plugin UI bugs:** Address the horizontal scrolling and cursor visibility issues to improve user experience in code review and Copilot interaction.
**Improve Ollama integration and installation experience:** Address conflicts with external Ollama installations and streamline the installation process to prevent issues and user frustration.
**Monitor and address the account linking issue:** While a new system is under development, continue to monitor and address issues with the current system to minimize user impact.

**Gather more data on Linux-specific issues:** While only one ticket mentioned Linux, the "Invalid port" issue suggests potential platform-specific problems. Gather more data to understand and address these issues effectively.

**Proactively communicate known issues and workarounds:** Keep users informed about the status of known issues, especially the account linking problem and the upcoming new system. Provide clear workarounds to minimize disruption.

**Consider expanding support channels:** Offering support through GitHub and Discord is helpful, but some users may prefer alternative channels like live chat or email. Explore expanding support options to cater to diverse preferences.
